meanings.definition: A membrane in the ear that vibrates in response to sound waves.
meanings.sent1: The eardrum helps us hear different sounds.
meanings.sent2: When you listen to music, your eardrum moves to catch the music.
meanings.sent3: The eardrum danced to the beat of the music, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her eardrum was like a delicate flower, swaying in the breeze of sound.
meanings.sent5: The eardrum is like a tiny drum inside your ear, playing the music of the world.

meanings.definition: The thin, cone-shaped membrane that separates the outer ear from the middle ear.
meanings.sent1: The doctor checked my eardrum to make sure it was healthy.
meanings.sent2: If you have an infection, your eardrum may hurt.
meanings.sent3: The eardrum wore a tiny hat to protect itself from the cold.
meanings.sent4: Her eardrum was a bridge between the outside world and her inner thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The eardrum is like a guardian, keeping harmful things out of your ear.
